special_features: Commentary by Katy Manning and Garrick Hagon.
Mutt Mad - documentary on making the story.
Race Against Time - representation in Doctor Who.
Dressing Doctor Who - interview with costume designer.

notes: Had working titles of Independence and The Emergents.
Last story to feature Tristram Cary's incidental music.
Explores themes akin to colonialism and apartheid.
Last appearance of the 'middle eight' version of end theme.

in_universe_mythology: The Solonian civilization and their cultural history.
The stages of transformation of Solonians into Mutts.
items: Message pod containing ancient stone tablets.

continuity_notes: The concept of mutants appears in other stories.
Shared themes of colonization with other episodes.

plot.plot_summary: The Doctor and Jo Grant arrive in the 30th century on a mission to deliver a message but become embroiled in a power struggle between the cruel Marshal of Solos and the oppressed Solonians.
The Marshal offers a deal to the Doctor: if he opens the message pod, Jo's safety can be ensured. The Doctor reluctantly agrees.
The Doctor uses his skills to reverse the effects of the atmosphere on Solos while those from the Skybase search for him.
A character named Professor Sondergaard helps the Doctor uncover the history of the Solonians through ancient texts in a collapsed cave system.
The Doctor confronts the Marshal, who is holding hostages as he attempts to terraform Solos under false pretenses.
The story culminates with the Doctor's plan succeeding against the Marshal, leading Ky to transcend into a powerful being while the Solonians are liberated.
